summary: Cross-model validation of ContinuumPort demonstrating task-oriented semantic continuity without memory, identity, or emotional persistence.
progress: A structured CP-Core container was successfully regenerated across multiple clean LLM sessions, preserving task intent and progress while enforcing strict non-anthropomorphic boundaries.

intent.primary: Demonstrate that continuity of work can be preserved across AI systems without simulating presence or self.
intent.secondary: Provide a portable, model-agnostic semantic snapshot suitable for clean-session regeneration.

notes: This container is language-agnostic by design. Semantic continuity is preserved by structure and intent, not by linguistic form.
